DataElement.preferredName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome-Specific Comorbidity Index Risk Status Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text term assigned to represent the predictive effect of commodities on outcomes in myelodysplastic syndromes combining the effect of five comorbidity factors and identifying three groups of MDS patients with probabilities of non-leukemic death and survival.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome-Specific Comorbidity Index Risk Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease-specific comorbidity index developed for predicting the effect of comorbidities on outcomes in myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS). It combines the effect of five comorbidity factors and identifies three groups of MDS patients with different probabilities of non-leukemic death and survival._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease-specific comorbidity index developed for predicting the effect of comorbidities on outcomes in myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS). It combines the effect of five comorbidity factors and identifies three groups of MDS patients with different probabilities of non-leukemic death and survival.

Concepts.definition: A disease-specific comorbidity index developed for predicting the effect of comorbidities on outcomes in myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS). It combines the effect of five comorbidity factors and identifies three groups of MDS patients with different probabilities of non-leukemic death and survival.
